intro: Trigonotis bodinieri, commonly known as the white-flowered trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in late spring to early summer.
